notes.text:
An update for libtiff is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The libtiff packages contain a library of functions for manipulating Tagged Image File Format (TIFF) files.

Security Fix(es):

* libtiff: a buffer overflow via the "invertImage()" may lead to DoS (CVE-2020-19131)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.6 Release Notes linked from the References section.
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

notes.text:
The libtiff package is susceptible to a heap/buffer overflow via the "invertImage()" which may lead to a DoS. 
The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: a buffer overflow via the "invertImage()" may lead to DoS
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running applications linked against libtiff must be restarted for this update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: a buffer overflow via the "invertImage()" may lead to DoS
